TopicTitle: Hi. And the drain needs a stop button.

Articles.Content:
The drain for the ESA update needs to stop when needed to stop. The drain willl drain an entire tank. But what if you want to drain like 10 units. Well. You can’t! And what if that causes problems? The drain part needs a stop button.

I’m talk g about the part that lest you drain fuel.

[re]start KSP, don't load a game, go to options, enable "Advanced Tweakables"

now the part context menus will have extra features available, including the drain unit rate, start/stop/toggle, etc.

I just want to add that Advanced Tweakables are a feature of the base game, they are stock.

One of the most useful features hidden in plain sight.

Autostruts and extremely useful context menus, it pains me that its not enabled by default since its so easy to miss, even for some veteran players.

Edited October 11, 2020 by Boyster
Looks like this turned out to be a gameplay question. And so, moved.

How are we supposed to know where and how to turn on advanced teakabels. Begginers players don’t know that. So it should be a regular thing! I didn’t even find the advanced tweekables for 9 months. And it lptook an hour for maple to ring the button!

not to toot my own horn, but also pointing out that my mod "FullAutoStrut" requires "Advanced Tweakables" to be enabled, and offers an easy enable button within the mod if it isn't, so you won't have to go searching for said game setting.

Absolutely.  I see nothing in the Advanced Tweakables options that would be intimidating for new players.  Just the opposite, not having some of the not-actually-that-advanced features is going to be detrimental.  The whole functionality of the Advanced Tweakables toggle being an option should be removed, or at the very least defaulted to 'on'.
